intro: Ruehssia gualanensis, commonly known as the Gualanensis Ruehssia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
